intro: Geocaryum, commonly known as the "earth seed," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its fibrous root system and aromatic, often hairy stems. The leaves are usually alternate and pinnately compound, with a distinctive, sometimes fern-like appearance. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Geocaryum species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
